definition: (typically followed by 就[jiu4]) apt to (lose one's temper, catch a cold etc)/at the drop of a hat
(of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb
(of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb
to be quick to take offence/to have a short fuse
pinyin: dong4 bu5 dong4 jiu4 sheng1 qi4

sentences.english: He had become very still. Saliva was at the corners of his mouth.
sentences.chinese: 爸爸已经一动不动了，嘴角上还淌着口水。

sentences.english: The fish was silvery and still and floated with the waves.
sentences.chinese: 那鱼是银色的，一动不动地随着波浪浮动着。

sentences.english: He was rooted to the spot by surprise.
sentences.chinese: 他惊讶得一动不动地站在原地。

sentences.english: It is posted on the company's website and handed out at the slightest excuse.
sentences.chinese: 个人小传登在公司网站上，而且动不动就被发送出去。

sentences.english: Not a breath of fresh air stirred the long white curtains.
sentences.chinese: 连一丝风也没有，白色的长窗帘一动不动。

sentences.english: It then lies still, waiting for prey to pass by.
sentences.chinese: 变色完成后，它就一动不动，等猎物经过。

sentences.english: Jane stood froze from head to toe and watched the car accelerate down the street.
sentences.chinese: 简一动不动地站在那儿，看着那辆车沿街急驰而去。

sentences.english: The fish was silvery and till and floated with the waves.
sentences.chinese: 那鱼是银色的，一动不动地随着波浪浮动着。

sentences.english: And she continued to look at him fixedly all the time.
sentences.chinese: 她仍然一动不动地望着他。

sentences.english: They may just sit in front of the computer and ask for this and that without moving.
sentences.chinese: 他们可能只是坐在电脑前，一动不动地要这要那。

sentences.english: Barkis lay silently there, not moving.
sentences.chinese: 巴克斯静静地躺着，一动不动。

sentences.english: He sat on the bench without movement.
sentences.chinese: 他坐在长凳上，一动不动。

sentences.english: She is disposed to sudden bouts of depression.
sentences.chinese: 她动不动就会突然抑郁症发作。

sentences.english: Fache never flinched, his eyes riveted on the second agent.
sentences.chinese: 法希毫不畏缩，他的眼睛一动不动地注视着那名特工。

sentences.english: He made no move to get up or take his eyes off the page.
sentences.chinese: 他依然一动不动的坐在那儿，盯着网页看。

definition: lit. twice every three days (idiom); practically every day/frequently
to criticize (as a matter of principle)
cannot bear to see/to hate/to dislike/to disapprove
to grimace with displeasure/to pull a long face
simple home-style meal/common occurrence/nothing out of the ordinary
